**Response**: To update the settings of a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) using the Virtual Private Cloud API, create a `patch` object containing the desired updates and use the 'update_vpc' request with the API. For example:

```json
{
  op: replace,
  path: /name,
  value: new_vpc_name
}

curl --request PATCH \
  --url https://vpc.api.example.com/v1/vpc/{vpc_id} \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer {token}' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{patches:[{...}]}'
```
Replace the placeholders `{vpc_id}`, `{token}`, and `new_vpc_name` with your actual VPC ID, access token, and the new VPC name respectively. Adjust the `path` key as needed to update specific properties of your VPC.

This example demonstrates patching the name of a VPC.
